triples.name: Network science
triples.relevance: The foundational field that provides the theoretical framework for studying complex systems through networks.

triples.name: Simplicial complex
triples.relevance: A mathematical structure used to represent higher-order networks and capture relationships beyond pairwise interactions.

triples.name: Synchronization
triples.relevance: A key dynamical process examined in higher-order networks where coupled systems coordinate their behavior.

triples.name: Complex contagion
triples.relevance: A contagion process studied on higher-order networks to understand information and behavioral spreading.

triples.name: Cooperation (evolution)
triples.relevance: A key evolutionary dynamics phenomenon analyzed on higher-order networks to understand group interactions.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: A dynamical process where agents reach agreement through local interactions on networked systems.
